headline: Muncy Man Files Suit to Keep Mastriano, Cong. Perry Off Ballot
author: WKOK Staff
sentences: WILLIAMSPORT – PennLive is reporting… A Lycoming County resident is challenging the right of two conservative Republicans to be on next month’s primary ballot because of their roles in the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol insurrection and their efforts to overturn the 2020 election results.

Jeffrey D. Hill of Muncy, a registered Democrat, in documents filed Friday and Monday in U.S. Middle District Court, claims actions taken by state Sen. Doug Mastriano and U.S. Rep. Scott Perry disqualify them under the state constitution.

These are among the reasons Hill claims Mastriano, a state senator from Franklin County, should be disqualified:
Chartered buses at his expense to transport people to then President Trump’s rally that preceded the riot at the Capitol.

“The people of southcentral Pennsylvania continue to re-elect the congressman because he is fighting for them, their values and their priorities.” Attempts to reach a spokesperson for the Mastriano campaign were unsuccessful.

Hill’s claims that disqualify Perry, a York County resident seeking his sixth term in Congress, from being on the ballot include:
Objected to the ratification of 2020 Electoral College votes.
He contends the two violated their oaths to support the U.S. Constitution by engaging in subversive activities leading up to the storming of the Capitol and the violence that ensued.
“This is just a sad and desperate lawsuit from the liberal left who have been unsuccessful in beating Congressman Perry at the ballot box,” campaign spokesman Matthew E. Beynon said.
Even if he is successful, their names still would appear on the primary ballot because it is too late to remove them, said Forrest Lehman, Lycoming County elections director said.
Joined a Republican delegation that met with Trump in the Oval Office to discuss overturning the election after Joe Biden had been certified the winner.
Should either or both be disqualified, signs would be affixed to machines stating votes for them would not be counted, he explained.
Hill, who represents himself, has filed numerous federal and state lawsuits over the years on a variety of topics.
Was with former state Rep. Rick Saccone when the latter encouraged insurrectionists to storm the Capitol.
Strategized and participated with Trump in schemes aimed at overturning the election results.
Hill is seeking expedited action on his requests to have Mastriano and Perry disqualified.
Voted against a bill that authorized an investigation into Russian war crimes in Ukraine.
He and his wife were photographed at the Capitol as rioters were breaching police lines.
Refused to cooperate with the House committee investigating what occurred on Jan.6.
Considers far-right groups such as the Oath Keepers and Proud Boys as patriots.
Mastriano is one of nine GOP candidates running for governor.
